reviews.review: a
ghostface players are automatically inferior to other people
alright

Here's an honest review from someone who may not have too much time on the game, but has hit high red ranks as killer.

 If you do well in a game, 9 times out of 10 at least one person will DC. This is a massive problem, as it almost always means that you won't be able to pip up unless you 3k and do literally everything perfectly. The toxicity in this game is astounding, and this is from someone who's played 1700 hours of Siege. BHVR has also turned their back on the cheating epidemic almost completely, meaning that whenever you get a cheater, no matter how blatant, nothing will come of it. At least in Siege, a cheater will get banned after a few months. Not in DBD. 
 Starting out as a killer, you won't have access to almost any good perks, outside of those you can get from Billy and Nurse, though everything but perhaps Tinkerer drops off in mid-high ranks. You are essentially forced to buy DLC killers to get their perks, or you can wait weeks upon weeks just to cry as you watch Iron Will and Agitation be put in the shrine for the 3rd week in a row.
 
 So, in conclusion, this game is dogshit. While you may have a wholesome interaction with a streamer that's positive once in a while, you will constantly have to face cheaters and dc's, making red ranks a swamp where hopes of ever hitting rank one is crushed by people having good coms and teamwork absolutely destroying you, or by some random Leon and his SWF friend, both with 3.5k hours, dcing after he gets downed at 5 gens because someone cleanses Haunted Grounds.

DBD is two very different games in one. The first game is horrible and I hate it. You're a survivor running from a killer, trying to fix up generators to power exit switches to open a door to escape the hunting ground, even though in the lore you just escape back to this endless nightmare forest until you wander into another hunting ground. It's fun with friends, or so I hear.

The second game is a blast. You play as a killer hunting down a group of survivors, using your powers to strike them down and impale them on hanging meat hooks to sacrifice them to 'the entity'. You gotta think smart and weigh the balance of checking generators vs chasing survivors, and skill comes in to play with how you use the powers along with your perks and items. There's a good variety of original characters, and every few releases brings a licensed character which is always fun to see.

Most importantly, this game has an active fan-base and I never have much trouble finding a game, particularly when playing at night. I've found it's harder finding games as a lone survivor, but since I mainly play killer that's not an issue for me, and if you want to play survivor then playing with friends solves that problem.

Another noteworthy mention is the challenge and progression system, the game offers 'tomes' that have a branching path of challenges, which helps focus the gameplay and give you goals within the game that rewards you with 'bloodpoints' which are spent on buying items and perks to level up your characters. It's a good loop that always gives you something to do.

tl:dr; If you like running in fear, and/or survival horror with friends, you'll probably enjoy this. If you like hunting down folk and beating 'em up with spooky powers, you'll probably enjoy this. I have fun with it.

Definitely a great game to mess around with your friends, Whether you like to scare the absolute souls out of your amigos or just like to take them out slowly and stealthily then this is your type of game. 

This game follows a simple 4v1 concept, 4 survivors 1 killer. The Survivors main objective is to complete the generators and find an escape (optional escape via a late game spawned hatch with random locations) 

The Killers job is to exterminate the Survivors and sacrifice their souls to the Entity via the sacrificial hooks filling the fog of the map. 

There are many different characters to choose from ranging from original characters and licensed characters from your favorite franchises. 

I hope to see you in the fog one day, and remember..Death is not an escape.

I have played Dead by Daylight for countless hours and despite the toxic community, I do have quite a lot of fun. Getting into the game can be tough especially if you have no perks but once you get set up with good perks and a decent team, the game gets a lot better.

I started playing this game on PS4 about 4 years ago and I had a ton of fun playing it then. I bought it yesterday  just because I wanted to play it again and it's still as fun as it was then. And there is a ton of new things that were added to the game. I definitely recommend this game if your looking for a horror game with multiple killers such as Micheal Myers, Freddy Krueger, etc.

The games only balancing aspect is that the learning curve is jacked and its easy to f%*k up.
Most killers are useless or OP, Survivor has 8 trillion crutch perks, but playing solo is still a death sentence.
The Matchmaking... We wont talk about

I still play cause i'm a masochist and an idiot.
Anyways, good luck, have fun, thanks for tuning in <3

I play MANY other online games without issue. This game could be so good but with these continued issues it's trash.

Dead by NFTs. It's a shame how the devs have gotten greedier over the years to the point of siding with NFTs. As for the actual game play? The devs can't release anything new without it completely breaking, or breaking another facet of the game and the "balancing" is a joke. Not to mention SBMM that doesn't fit in or work in the first place.

If this were a year ago I'd give this game a solid 9/10 but now? A fat 2/10. "Pretty good job so far."

While its most certainly not a "Bad" game, DBD can be incredibly inconsistent, buggy/glitchy, and at times can feel unfair. If you don't mind intense chases almost every match (Whether as Killer or Survivor), then it's wonderful. Casually, though, it is impossible to enjoy in my opinion.

Update February 2022: Still garbage casually.
